p: Ferrets were infected intranasally with 2.5 × 10 5 plaque-forming units (PFU) in 500 μL and monitored for 10 d.p.i. Four ferrets were housed by infection group. Nasal wash specimens were collected and stored. Nasal washes were collected daily until 6 d.p.i. Animals were weighed, visually inspected daily, and their temperature was measured using electronic identification chips with temperature monitoring. Nasal wash virus titers were expressed as 50% log10 tissue culture infectious doses (TCID50) [ 21, 22].
